subject: AI & Agents
title: Alan Turing's Universal Machine
description: A micro-lesson that makes Alan Turing's Universal Machine usable.

hook.text: In 1936, a 24-year-old mathematician proved that one machine could simulate any other.

buildup.text: Alan Turing described a theoretical machine that reads symbols and follows rules on an infinite tape.

discovery.text: This 'Turing machine' became the foundation of computer science â€” and eventually AI.

twist.text: During WWII, Turing built a real machine that cracked Nazi codes and shortened the war.

climax.text: He then asked the question that launched AI: 'Can machines think?'

punchline.text: One question from one man started an entire field.

quiz.question: What did Turing's theoretical machine prove?
options: One machine could simulate any other machine
